document_data.name: ''Horned Ring''
document_data.creator: [[Halaster Blackcloak]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''''horned rings''''' were eight [[enchanted]] [[ring]]s that the mad wizard [[Halaster]] created for himself and his seven apprentices.
document_data.Description: These [[iron]] rings had small horns rising out of them that curved backward toward the wearer's fingers.
document_data.Powers:
Halaster imbued each of the eight ''horned rings'' with distinct powers and immunities, only accessible by the individual they were designed for. Anyone else who wore one of these rings had access to only one or more powers.

The most common power of the ''horned rings'' was similar to Halaster's [[Halaster's teleportation ring|''teleportation rings'']] or the ''[[greater teleport]]'' [[spell]], but teleported the wearer to different locations within [[Undermountain]]. The wearer was also able to specify where they wished to teleport. Following the [[Spellplague]], this was the only power of the rings available to laypeople.

The ring could break through any magical barriers, with the exception of ''[[prismatic wall]]s'' or ''[[prismatic sphere]]s'', to get them there safely, allowing it to bypass ''[[Halaster's teleport cage]]''. And the wearer could cloak themselves upon command in an ''[[antimagic aura]]''.

In order to recharge itself, a ''horned ring'' would absorb any incoming ''[[magic missile]]s'' and magical and natural electrical energy directed at the wearer. The wearer was completely protected from attacks of these kinds while wearing a ''horned ring''.

document_data.Rumors & Legends: Rumors abounded that the ''horned rings'' allowed Halaster to remotely view their wearer and read their thoughts.
